content: We'll have our weekly meeting in about an hour: https://ct.gdcc.io

I was donating blood yesterday and had a tight work schedule yesterday, but read over the meeting document this morning. With regards to the postgres init issue I am playing around with that more today. The init.sql script I thought would be needed is not needed, but I am trying to setup an additional compose instance that uses a different default database for testing purposes. I was fighting with Windows to remove the postgres cache when tearing down and recomposing the docker containers, but I believe I have that working (using PowerShell vs WSL made a difference in composing success or failure).
Shoot. I just realized I'll need to cut our meeting tomorrow short by half an hour because we have an all hands meeting at work.

:sweat_smile: SORRY!
How about you add it to the IQSS Google Drive and make it a public file we can link to and has a player?

:sweat_smile:

:see_no_evil:

37 minutes. Great! Thanks.
Sorry about that again, I will triple check next time :sweat_smile:
No worries! Better two recordings than zero! :grinning:

Ok, I updated website etc. See you on the 27th! Those who can make it. :crazy:

So! I just talked to Stefano and we're planning on switching the container meetings from weekly to monthly. Containerization is still very important to us but we've got lots of priorities, including the rewrite of the Dataverse frontend.

Is any particular week better than others? Should we go for the first Thursday of the month? What do you think @Oliver Bertuch @Don Sizemore @Kris Dekeyser (KU Leuven) @Loïc @Akio Sone and others?
First, last, 2nd, ... Thursday of the month. It's all fine for me.

Let's try the first Thursday of each month. That means we'll cancel tomorrow's meeting and we'll regroup on Thursday, March 6th. Same time as always. I'll go update the website, etc. And rename this topic in Zulip!
See you in about 3.5 hours! Please feel free to add to the agenda: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1D0wVno-7tZhmMrNDYNVvwgjtp4DR7p6JCp8yKuyzoJw/edit?usp=sharing

Unless some heavenly intervention happens, I'll be there and available for such a meetup
